Well, one thing I can see right now is (but wouldnt case your problem):
if(player.getInventory().contains(m.getRaw())) {
twice, but you don’t remove the raw ID in between them?

I also see
this.stop();
in your executable, but a lot of your code is just poorly constructed so I have no idea why it’s there…

item.title: [Hyperion]Cooking[Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

If I put System.out.println(j); with the current code it will print out 0, then 1 and only cook one fish. I believe this is because it is looping through once, then it will go to loop through again, but since 4 ticks haven’t been over yet (2.4 seconds), the player still has the cooking attribute and it returns, thus ending the 2nd loop.

Read full topic

item.title: [Hyperion]Cooking[Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Will only cook one. I know why, but I don’t know how to justify it. The issue is, is that the for loop is ending before the tick is over. Here’s my code… my Java knowledge may just be insufficient.

[code=java5]
public static void startCookMeat(final Player player, int cookingAmount) {
for (final Meats m : Meats.meats.values()) {
for (int j = 0; j < cookingAmount; j++) {
if(player.getInventory().contains(m.getRaw())) {
if(player.hasAttributeTag(“cooking”)) {
return;
}
if(getCookingType() == true) {
player.playAnimation(Animation.create(897));
}
if(getCookingType() == false) {
player.playAnimation(Animation.create(883));
}
player.getAttributeTags().add(“cooking”);
if(!player.getInventory().contains(m.getRaw())) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You don’t have any more " + m.getBurnMessage() + " to cook.”);
return;
}
if(player.getInterfaceState().isInterfaceOpen(1743)) {
player.getInterfaceState().interfaceClosed();
}
World.getWorld().submit(new Tickable(4) {
@Override
public void execute() {
if(Misc.random(100) >= 60 - ((player.getSkills().getLevel(Skills.COOKING) - m.getLevelReq()) * (60 / (getBurnLevel() - m.getLevelReq())))) {
player.getInventory().remove(new Item(m.getRaw()));
player.getInventory().add(new Item(m.getCooked()));
player.getSkills().addExperience(Skills.COOKING, m.getExp() * Constants.EXP_MODIFIER);
player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You successfully cook " + m.getCookMessage() + “.”);
} else {
player.getInventory().remove(new Item(m.getRaw()));
player.getInventory().add(new Item(m.getBurnt()));
player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You accidentally burn the " + m.getBurnMessage() + “.”);
}
player.getAttributeTags().remove(“cooking”);
this.stop();
}
});
}
}
}
}

public static void setupCookMeat(Player player, int ITEM_ID, int OBJECT_ID) {
    for (Meats m : Meats.meats.values()) {
        if (m.getRaw() == ITEM_ID) {
            if(player.getSkills().getLevel(Skills.COOKING) < m.getLevelReq()) {
                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need level " + m.getLevelReq() + " cooking to cook this item.");
                return;
            }
            if(player.getInventory().contains(m.getRaw())) {
                player.getActionSender().sendInterfaceChat(1743);
                player.getActionSender().sendInterfaceModel(13716, 200, m.getRaw());
                if(OBJECT_ID == 114) {
                    setBurnLevel(1, ITEM_ID);
                }
                if(player.getEquipment().contains(775)) {
                    if (ITEM_ID == 359 || ITEM_ID == 377 || ITEM_ID == 371 || ITEM_ID == 7944 || ITEM_ID == 383 || ITEM_ID == 395 || ITEM_ID == 389) {
                        setBurnLevel(6, ITEM_ID);
                    }
                }
                if(OBJECT_ID == 114) {
                    if(player.getEquipment().contains(775)) {
                        if (ITEM_ID == 359 || ITEM_ID == 377 || ITEM_ID == 371 || ITEM_ID == 7944 || ITEM_ID == 383 || ITEM_ID == 395 || ITEM_ID == 389) {
                            setBurnLevel(7, ITEM_ID);
                        }
                    }
                }
                if(OBJECT_ID == 2732) {
                    setBurnLevel(-1, ITEM_ID);
                }
                if(OBJECT_ID == 2732) {
                    setCookingType(player, range, OBJECT_ID);
                }
                if(OBJECT_ID == 114 || OBJECT_ID == 2728 || OBJECT_ID == 2729 || OBJECT_ID == 2730 || OBJECT_ID == 2731) {
                    setCookingType(player, range, OBJECT_ID);
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

public static double burnLevel;

public static void setBurnLevel(int burnLevelDecrement, int ITEM_ID) {
    Meats m = Meats.meats.get(ITEM_ID);
    burnLevel = m.getBurnLevel() - burnLevelDecrement;
}

public static double getBurnLevel() {
    return burnLevel;
}

public static boolean range;

public static void setCookingType(Player player, boolean range, int OBJECT_ID) {
    if(OBJECT_ID == 2732) {
        range = false;
    }
    if(OBJECT_ID == 114 || OBJECT_ID == 2728 || OBJECT_ID == 2729 || OBJECT_ID == 2730 || OBJECT_ID == 2731) {
        range = true;
    }
}

public static boolean getCookingType() {
    return range;
}

}[/code]

When I click on Cook 1 and Cook 5 I have these set up in where I handle action buttons. They both only cook one.

[code=java5]
//Cooking
case 13720:
Cooking.startCookMeat(player, 1);
break;

            case 13719:
                Cooking.startCookMeat(player, 5);
                break;[/code]

:mad: Can’t concept a way to fix this…

Read full topic
